intro: Prenanthes acanthifolia, commonly known as the thorned bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescence. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and has small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and are surrounded by a spathe, which is a modified leaf-like structure. Prenanthes acanthifolia is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams.
